intro: Rhynchospora racemosa, commonly known as the clustered spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland and marshy habitats in North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes grass-like plants known as sedges. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces dense, spike-like inflorescences that are typically reddish or purple in color. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, with three stamens and a single pistil, typical of the sedge family. Rhynchospora racemosa plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various wetland organisms.
